content.description: Scientists calculated the net primary productivity at two different forest sites. Both forests have the same gross primary productivity. Forest <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has a net primary productivity of <math alttext="1,650 kilocalories, per meters squared, per year" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>650</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kcal/</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>/</mo><mtext>year</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and forest <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has a net primary productivity of <math alttext="1,110 kilocalories, per meters squared, per year" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>110</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kcal/</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>/</mo><mtext>year</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: Which of the following statements is best supported by the data?

choices.label: Forest <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has a higher rate of decomposition by bacteria than forest <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Forest <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has more biodiversity than forest <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Forest <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> producers have lower rates of cellular respiration than forest <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> producers.

Forest <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> producers have more biomass than forest <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> producers.

content.answer: Forest <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> producers have lower rates of cellular respiration than forest <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> producers.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe environmental concepts and processes.
